page.title: 16Religion, Barnston,Lt Dunmow
page.content:
There are three places of Christian Worship within Barnston and Little Dunmow, the oldest being Little Dunmow Priory which dates back to 1104 and was originally the size of a cathederal. After the Dissolution of the Monastries only the Lady Chapel was left standing and now serves as the Parish Church known as Saint Mary's.
Little Dunmow shares a rector with Barnston where the church dates from Norman times and an unusual feature is the barrel organ with a repertoire of twelve tunes. Also in Barnston is the Mission Evangelical Church founded at the beginning of this century housed in what was once a "piggery". There is no minister in charge and the affairs are run by the worshippers.
